message: It won't be a problem if we all leave the whitespace as it is for now; equally, it won't be a problem if we all start stripping whitespace.
We should probably do the same for making sure the code adhers to PEP 8.
I'm inclined to leave it as it is until we all merge into brutasse/master, and clean it up then. That sound OK?

Just a quickie. I've noticed that the code doesn't seem to be whitespace stripped. I'd normally do this, but if it's only me, then experience tells me that it's a recipe for conflicts (albeit trivial) on merge.
So I already have commits with such changes, I hadn't thought about the merge issues.
Hm, when I change a significant portion of a file I usually clean it up (imports, whitespace, pep8 and pyflakes)
